title: How did Dobby learn of Harry Potter's existence? - Quora
tags: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (1998 book)

response.answer_text: I suspect that when Draco was very young Narcissa read the unauthorised ‘Harry Potter’ books to him, the ones in which Harry was portrayed as a heroic magical prodigy who lived in a magical palace and defeated Acromantulas at the age of six, and Dobby listened in and came to believe that Harry was a Great Wizard and liberator. How he twisted this into believing that the Great Harry Potter had to be protected, even at the cost of subjecting him to imprisonment, torture, and horrible life-threatening injury, is beyond me - but then I’m not a comic-relief insane house elf. For me, the greatest moment in the whole series was when Bellatrix knifed the little creep.

“How did Dobby learn of Harry Potter’s existence?” That’s a pretty simple answer. He learned of it from the Malfoys. Lucious was one of Voldemort’s biggest followers. Undoubtedly, he heard the whole tale of what had happened when Voldemort was beaten, so I’m sure he would’ve talked about it at length at home in front of Dobby. He barely noticed Dobby’s existence unless he needed anything, so I doubt he would’ve cared what he said in front of him. Lucious was also basically the defacto leader of the former death eaters after Voldemort’s fall, so I’d be fairly certain that a lot of them frequented his Manor and talked about all sorts of things involving Voldemort and Harry Potter. After Draco’s first year, he saw fit to talk continuously about Harry Potter and how much he hated him after he came home. I’m sure there were plenty of discussions about Harry between Draco and Lucious.
